TopicTitle: Open source models of a standard Kerbal?

Articles.Content:
I am looking for a simple 3D model of a typical Kerbal I can use to help design interior spaces. Any ideas?

I understand a typical Kerbal is 0.75m tall and from that I can model up my own "Kerbal-dummy" for kinematics purposes but that can only take me so far. How long are their arms and where do they articulate? How far above the feet are the knees? I can probably make a hallway easy enough but what about more particular spaces like a chair? I need more information on how a Kerbal is built.

The one I use is an awesome kerbal model by Anariaq.

Download:

http://db.tt/5qf4LXPm

Also, just a correction, Kerbals are 1 meter tall.
Nutt, thanks for sharing that and if you know the creator thank him to =) Been looking for a way to compare things making in unity and ksp cheers!
thanks allot,now i can finally start making iva's

Is that model positioned and scaled correctly based upon the in-game assets ? So if I put it exactly on top of the seat transform can I basically wrap the model in stuff and have it fit and not clip any of it? (allowing for the idle animations moving the heads, legs nad arms a bit).

A reference for where the camera is and it's FOV and how it turns would also be awesome, if I had all those parts I wouldn't have to move something 5mm in unity, re-load KSP's database and check if the angle/position is right so the kerbal can see it without something else being in the way, or doesn't clip into a kerbal etc.
